Recommendation: Annual imaging follow-up may be considered if clinically indicated. No urgent action required.
Recommend dedicated adrenal protocol CT or MRI for further characterization. Refer to endocrinology.

Condition: Mass >4cm, or suspicious features (e.g., >10 HU non-contrast).
Recommendation: Urgent referral to endocrinology and likely surgical consultation for suspected malignancy.
Recommend annual ultrasound surveillance.
Recommend semi-annual ultrasound surveillance. Consider vascular surgery consultation.
Urgent referral to vascular surgery for repair evaluation.
likely reactive thickening. Clinically correlate. If asymptomatic no further action needed.
Recommend clinical correlation for inflammatory bowel disease. Consider gastroenterology referral.
asymmetric thickening suggestive of malignancy. Recommend colonoscopy or dedicated CT enterography. Urgent gastroenterology referral.

Condition: Mild CAC (1-99) or mild valve disease.
Recommendation: Inform patient and PCP. Recommend routine cardiovascular risk management.

Condition: Moderate CAC (100-400) or moderate valve disease.
Recommendation: Recommend cardiology consultation for risk stratification and management.

Condition: Incidental CAC with known CAD or already under management
Recommendation: Manage under CAD/secondary prevention pathway or verify statin intensity/adherence with PCP.

Condition: Severe CAC (>400 Agatston) or severe valve stenosis/regurg.
Recommendation: Urgent cardiology consultation.
Recommend smoking cessation counseling if applicable. Inform PCP.
Recommend PCP follow-up for pulmonary function testing and management.

Condition: Severe emphysema with signs of exacerbation.
Recommendation: Recommend urgent PCP or pulmonology follow-up.

Condition: On patients known problem list or being managed by pulmonologist.
Recommendation: Manage under COPD/exacerbation prevention pathway or verify medication adherence with PCP.
Typically incidental. No follow-up needed unless symptomatic.
Recommend dedicated gallbladder ultrasound and surgical consultation.

Condition: Wall thickening >3mm, mass, or significant ductal dilation.
Recommendation: Urgent referral for surgical/gastroenterology evaluation for possible malignancy.
Recommend short-interval (6-month) follow-up mammogram.
Recommend biopsy. Refer to breast surgery/radiology.
Urgent referral for biopsy and surgical consultation.
No routine follow-up recommended per Fleischner guidelines.
Recommend follow-up low-dose CT at 3-6 months per Fleischner guidelines.
Recommend PET-CT and/or biopsy. Refer to pulmonology.
Incidental finding. Inform PCP. No specific follow-up required.

Condition: Non-fibrotic ILA involving >5% of lung zone.
Recommendation: Recommend pulmonology consultation for evaluation.
Urgent referral to pulmonology for management of likely interstitial lung disease.
Benign findings. No follow-up needed.
Recommend multiphasic MRI or CT for characterization. Consider gastroenterology/hepatology referral.

Condition: LI-RADS 5, or new/growing lesion in cirrhosis.
Recommendation: Urgent referral to hepatology/oncology for management of likely hepatocellular carcinoma.
Recommend follow-up low-dose CT in 6 months.
Recommend follow-up low-dose CT in 3 months or PET/CT.
Recommend biopsy or further diagnostic workup. Urgent pulmonology referral.
Likely benign. No follow-up needed unless clinically indicated.
Recommend clinical correlation and consider follow-up imaging in 3 months.

Condition: Nodes with necrotic center, or >1.5cm short axis.
Recommendation: Suspicious for malignancy or infection. Recommend biopsy and appropriate clinical referral.
Follow-up ultrasound may be recommended based on size and patient age.
Recommend gynecologic consultation and likely MRI for further characterization.
Urgent referral to gynecologic oncology.
No follow-up required.
Recommend follow-up with MRCP in 6-12 months.

Condition: Solid mass, or cyst >= 3cm with worrisome features (mural nodule, dilated duct).
Recommendation: Urgent referral to gastroenterology/surgical oncology.
Recommend routine PSA monitoring with PCP.
Recommend urology consultation for consideration of biopsy.

Condition: PI-RADS 5 on MRI, or clear extra-prostatic extension.
Recommendation: Urgent referral to urology for biopsy and staging.

Condition: Simple cyst (Bosniak I/II) or small non-enhancing lesion.
Recommendation: Benign. No follow-up required.

Condition: Solid enhancing mass 1-4cm, or Bosniak III cyst.
Recommendation: Recommend urology consultation for management which may include surveillance or treatment.

Condition: Solid enhancing mass >4cm, or complex cystic (Bosniak IV).
Recommendation: Urgent referral to urology for surgical evaluation.
Benign. No follow-up required.
Recommend follow-up imaging (e.g. MRI) for characterization.
Recommend surgical or hematology consultation.
Recommend follow-up ultrasound in 12 months.
Recommend fine-needle aspiration (FNA) biopsy. Refer to endocrinology.
Recommend fine-needle aspiration (FNA) biopsy. Urgent referral to endocrinology.
Recommend PCP follow-up for osteoporosis evaluation.
Recommend PCP follow-up for osteoporosis management and consider orthopedic consultation.

Condition: Severe (>40%) height loss, or suspected pathologic fracture.
Recommendation: Urgent orthopedic or spine surgery consultation to rule out instability or malignancy.

Condition: Adrenal mass already characterized or under endocrinology surveillance/management.
Recommendation: Continue established endocrinology follow-up/surveillance; no new workup unless clinical change.

Condition: AAA/TAA documented and under vascular program or post-EVAR/TEVAR surveillance.
Recommendation: Continue vascular surgery surveillance per program interval; coordinate with vascular team.

Condition: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohnâ€™s/UC) documented and under GI management.
Recommendation: Continue gastroenterology management plan; no separate incidental pathway action.

Condition: Known gallbladder/biliary disease already worked up or scheduled with GI/surgery.
Recommendation: Continue GI/surgical plan; no additional navigator action unless plan lapses.

Condition: Breast finding enrolled in breast imaging/surgery pathway (surveillance/biopsy scheduled).
Recommendation: Continue breast program plan; follow scheduled imaging/procedures.

Condition: Pulmonary nodule in active surveillance (pulmonology or lung nodule clinic).
Recommendation: Continue nodule surveillance per existing interval; no duplicate orders.

Condition: Known ILD/ILA followed by pulmonology/ILD clinic with established imaging plan.
Recommendation: Continue ILD pathway and imaging cadence with pulmonology.

Condition: Benign liver lesion (e.g., hemangioma/simple cyst) previously characterized and under surveillance if indicated.
Recommendation: Continue hepatology/GI plan; no new workup unless interval change.

Condition: Patient enrolled in lung cancer screening program with scheduled LDCT interval.
Recommendation: Continue screening program interval; coordinate with program as needed.

Condition: Nodes previously characterized/reactive or under oncology/ID/rheumatology follow-up.
Recommendation: Continue specialist/PCP plan; repeat workup only if clinical change.

Condition: Adnexal finding under gynecology/gynecologic oncology pathway with imaging or surgery plan.
Recommendation: Continue Gyn/Gyn-Onc plan; follow scheduled imaging/procedures.

Condition: Pancreatic cyst/IPMN under GI or surgical oncology surveillance (e.g., MRCP/EUS schedule).
Recommendation: Continue established surveillance interval and specialty follow-up.

Condition: Prostate finding under urology active surveillance/biopsy pathway.
Recommendation: Continue urology plan; no duplicative orders.

Condition: Renal lesion under urology management/surveillance or post-procedure follow-up.
Recommendation: Continue urology pathway and scheduled imaging.

Condition: Benign splenic lesion documented as stable or under specialty/PCP follow-up.
Recommendation: Continue existing plan; no additional workup unless interval change.

Condition: Thyroid nodule under endocrinology with TI-RADS/FNA pathway or surveillance cadence.
Recommendation: Continue endocrine plan and scheduled ultrasound/FNA as indicated.

Condition: Compression fracture/osteoporosis under endocrine/orthopedic management or osteoporosis clinic.
Recommendation: Continue specialist/PCP management (DEXA/therapy) per existing plan.
